## A workshop case study on webscraping

Using the `rvest` library to learn about web crawling and HTML parsing in R.

- Introduce just enough HTML/CSS
- Introduce the `library(rvest)` package for harvesting websites/HTML
- Tidyverse iteration with `purrr::map`

**Workshop Video**:  https://youtu.be/8ISc8V9GDAg

**See Also**:  [_What to know about law & ethics when archiving & mining data_](slides/What to know about law & ethics_Archiving & Mining_15 Min_with notes.pdf) by Rachael Samberg, J.D., MLIS
Timothy Vollmer, MIS & the UC Berkeley Office of Scholarly Communication Services youtube [playlists on navigating intellectual property, copyright, fair-use](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNUMwTyK0raTNNZVjhgB7KA/playlists).  **Please note**, the Samberg/Vollmer slides are found in this github repo's slides folder and are redistributed with permission from the slide authors.
